intro: Ichnocarpus fulvus, commonly known as the yellow false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, indehiscent pods that contain seeds with a distinctive, hooked appendage. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The botanical features of Ichnocarpus fulvus make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
